data.summary: News: Five arrested  for black marketeering | कालोबजारी गर्ने पाँच जना प्रहरीको फन्दामा ।
data.content:
NepalMonitor.org SMS Alert: Kathmandu/May 15, Kalo-bajari gareko arop ma prahari dwara upateka  ko bibhinna thau bata 5 janaa byapari pakrau.

Police have arrested five men for allegedly black marketeering at a time when the whole country is 
suffering from the rattle of the earthquake.

They were arrested from overcharging on items ranging from tarpaulins to energy drinks. The arrested have been identified as Uddhav Khatiwada of Manahara municipality-13, Achyut Prashad Acharya of the same place, Padam Bahadur KC of Chindanda-5 Arghakhanchi, Ganesh Prashad Siwakoti of Sunarawati-1 Dolakha, and Kul Prashad Neupane of Kagatitar-4 Arghakhanchi.

They were arrested from different places of Kathmandu valley.


भूकम्पको फाइदा उठाउँदै कालोबजारी गर्दै उपभोक्ताबाट अत्यधिक मूल्य असुल्ने पाँच जनालाई प्रहरीले पक्राउ गरेको छ । 

वास्तविक मूल्यभन्दा अत्यधिक बढी मूल्य लिई त्रिपाल बिक्रीवितरण गर्ने काठमाडौँ कागेश्वरी मनहरा नगरपालिका–१३ स्थित खतिवडा फेन्सी पसलका सञ्चालक उद्धव खतिवडा र सोही ठाउँस्थित आचार्य स्टोर्सका सञ्चालक अच्यूतप्रसाद आचार्यलाई प्रहरीले पक्राउ गरेको हो ।

एक हजार २६५ रुपैयाँमा खरिद गरेको त्रिपाल दुई हजार ५०० मा बिक्रीवितरण गरेको खबर प्राप्त भएपछि महानगरीय प्रहरी प्रभाग काँडाघारीले उनीहरूलाई नियन्त्रणमा लिएको हो ।

त्यसैगरी ‘रेडबुल’ र ‘रेडस्टर’ पेय पदार्थ अत्यधिक मूल्य लिई बिक्रीवितरण गर्ने नयाँ बसपार्क नजिक खुद्रा पसल गरी बस्ने अर्घाखाँची चिनडाँडा–५ का २९ वर्षीय पदमबहादुर केसी, दोलखा सुनरावती–१ का ३१ वर्षीय गणेशप्रसाद सिवाकोटी र सोही ठाउँ बस्ने अर्घाखाँची कागतीटार–४ का ३२ वर्षीय कुलप्रसाद न्यौपानेलाई पनि प्रहरीले पक्राउ गरेको छ ।

उनीहरूले रु ८० पर्ने रेडबुललाई ९० रुपैयाँ र रु ६५ पर्ने रेडस्टारलाई ८० रुपैयाँमा बिक्रीवितरण गरेको पाइएपछि महानगरीय अपराध महाशाखाले नियन्त्रणमा लिएको प्रहरीले जनाएको छ ।

data.summary: News: Earthquake victims seeking relief man-handled by police in Nuwakot | राहत माग्दा प्रहरीको हातपात गाउँलेद्धारा प्रहरीचौकी घेराउ ।
data.content:
NepalMonitor.org SMS Alert: Nuwakot/May 14, Rahat ko bisaya ma sodhpuch garna gayeka bhukampa pidit mathi prahari le aakraman garda 3 janaa ghaite.

Three persons in Bageswari VDC of Nuwakot have been injured after being beaten by police during discussion over relief distribution.

Due to the police's beating Sahadev Sapkota of Bageswari VDC-7 has broken his tooth and required stitches in his lip. Similarly Jit Bahadur Khale has sustained injury in his eye and Bharat Tamang's right leg has been fractured. The three injured said that police attacked them under the instruction of a local leader of Nepali Congress.

Local villagers surrounded Bageswari Police Station demanding action against those responsible for the attack and compensation to the three injured victims. Bageswari Police Station remained tense throughout Friday night due to the incident. Locals have been complaining that only a handful of resourceful and connected people were receiving relief material in large quantity while the original victims of the earthquake went empty handed.

Nuwakot district secretary of UCPN Maoist, Pushna Lamichane demanded the local administration to distribute the relief material in fair and transparent manner.

He strongly condemned the attack upon the victims of earthquake who had come to enquire about relief by the police under direction of few clever and resourceful men. 


राहत वितरणको विषयमा बुझ्न गएका स्थानीयबासीमाथि प्रहरीले हस्तक्षेप गर्दा बागेश्वरी गाविसमा तीन जना घाइते भएका छन् ।

बिहिबार राती बागेश्वरी गाविसमा राहत लिएर गएको विषयमा वडा नं. ७ र ९ मा राहतको विषयमा कुरा गर्न गएका स्थानीयबासीहरुमाथि बागेश्वरी प्रहरी चौकीका जवानले आफूहरुमाथि कुटपिट गरेको पीडितहरुले बताएका छन् ।

प्रहरीको कुटाइबाट बागेश्वरी गाविस वडा नंं ७ का सहदेव सापकोटाको दाँत भाँचिएर ओठमा टाँका लगाउनुपर्ने गरी घाइते भएका छन् । यस्तै जीतबहादुर खलेको आँखामा चोट लागेको छ भने भरत तामाङको दाइने खुट्टामा चोट लागेको छ । स्थानीय एक नेपाली कांग्रेसको नेतृत्व तहमा रहेका व्यक्तिको निर्देशनमा प्रहरीले आफूहरुमाथि दमन र अत्याचार गरेको पीडित सहदेव सापकोटाले जानकारी दिए ।

राहतको विषयमा एक कांग्रेसका जिल्लास्तरीय कार्यकर्तासहितको प्रहरी टोलीसँग सोधपुछ गर्ने क्रममा प्रहरीले सर्वसाधारणमाथि अत्याचार गरेको स्थानीयबासीहरुले बताएका छन् । सो विषयमा शुक्रवार रातभर बागेश्वरी प्रहरी चौकी क्षेत्रमा तनाव भएको थियो । प्रहरीको अत्याचारपछि स्थानीय गाउँलेहरुले प्रहरी चौकी घेराउ गरी घाइतेहरुको उपचार र दोषीमाथि कारवाहीको माग गर्दै रातभर नाराबाजी गरेका थिए ।

यसैवीच, एकीकृत नेकपा माओवादीका जिल्ला सचिव पुष्ण लामिछानेले जिल्लाभर राहत वितरण कार्यक्रम पारदर्शी र न्यायोचित बनाउन स्थानीय प्रशासनसँग माग गरेका छन् ।

जिल्लाका कतिपय स्थानहरुमा राहत वितरणमा पहुँचवाला र गुण्डागर्दी शैली देखिएकाले यसलाई सच्याएर सबै प्रभावित व्यक्तिको घरसम्म राहत पु¥याउन आग्रह गरेका छन् । उनले जिल्लाका अधिकांश स्थानमा राहत वितरणमा केही टाठापाठा व्यक्तिहरुको पहुँचको आधारमा कतै खातैखात र कतै एक पटक पनि राहत पुग्न नसकेको जनाउँदै वास्तविक पीडितसमक्ष राहत पुग्नुपर्ने बताए ।

उनले बागेश्वरी गाविसको वडा नं. ७ र ९ मा अहिलेसम्म कुनै पनि राहतका कार्यक्रम पुग्न नसकेको बताउँदै राहतको विषयमा बुझ्न आएका सर्वसाधारणमाथि केही टाठाबाठाको निर्देशनमा प्रहरी टोली नै परिचालन भएर घटाइएको अमानवीय व्यवहारले पार्टीलाई स्तब्ध बनाएको बताए ।

data.summary: News: Police post vandalised over allegation of tarpaulin distribution to businessman | प्रहरीले व्यापारीलाई पाल बाँडेको भन्दै चौकीमा ढुंगामुढा ।
data.content:
NepalMonitor.org SMS Alert: Kathmandu/May 14, Rahat ko tripal prahari le byapari lai bechna diyeko bhandai Thali prahari chauki ma dhunga-muda.

Irate locals of Thali have pelted stones at Thali police station accusing the police of handing over tarpaulins meant for relief material to a businessman who sold it at a hefty sum.

Police arrested local businessman Ganesh Jaiswal after locals accused him of black marketeering and tried to man-handle him. When interrogated by angry locals the businessman confessed that he had obtained the tarpaulins from police. The locals accused Thali police incharge sub-inspector Madhu Aryal of allowing the businessman to sell the tarpaulins. When Boudha police was transporting the arrested businessman angry locals pelted stone at the police vehicle. DSP Narahari Regmi of Boudha Police however denied the allegiations.
Sub-inspector Madhu Aryal was transferred from Thali police station on Wednesday.


राजधानीको थलीमा राहतको पाल प्रहरीले व्यापारीलाई बिक्री गर्न दिएको भन्दै स्थानीय वासिन्दाले प्रहरी चौकी थलीमा ढुंगामुढा गरेका छन्। 
 
स्थानीय जैसवाल ईन्टरपाईजेजका व्यापारी गणेश जैसवालले महँगोमा पाल बिक्री गरेपछि स्थानीयले कालोबजारी गरेको भन्दै कुटपीट गर्न खोजेपछि प्रहरीले पक्राउ गरेको थियो। जैसवाललाई बुधबार पक्राउ गरेर महानगरीय प्रहरी वृत्त बौद्धमा लैजाने क्रममा स्थानीयले प्रहरीमाथि नै जाईलागेका थिए। 
 
प्रहरी चौकी थलीका तत्कालीन ईन्चार्ज प्रहरी नायब निरिक्षक मधु अर्यालले राहतको पाल जैसवाललाई बिक्री गर्न दिएको आरोप स्थानीयको छ। स्थानीयले केरकार गरेपछि जैसवालले जोरपाटीबाट प्रहरीले दिएको स्वीकार गरेको जानकारी थलीका शिव वस्नेतले दिए। 
 
तर, प्रहरीले भने स्थानीयको आरोप झुटो भएको दावी गरेको छ। महानगरीय प्रहरी वृत्त बौद्धका प्रमुख डिएसपी नरहरी रेग्मीले पाल नपाएको आवेगमा प्रहरीमाथि झुटो लान्छना लगाएको दावी गरे। 

उनले भने,' प्रहरीले धेरै संयम अपनाएको हो, जैसवालले कालोबजारी गरेको आरोपमा हामीले पक्राउ गरेर कार्यालयमा ल्याउन खोज्दा समेत स्थानीयले ढुंगामुढा गरे, यस्तो विपद्मा प्रहरीले राहतको पाल बिक्री गर्छ भन्नु मुर्खता हो, डिएसपी रेग्मीले भने। 
 
व्यपारी जैसवालले दुई हजार पर्ने पाल ३५ सय सम्ममा बिक्री गर्दै आएका थिए। कालोबजारी अन्तर्गत कारबाही गर्न उनलाई प्रहरी वृत्त बौद्धमै राखिएको छ। 
 
थलीमा कार्यरत सई अर्याललाई बुधबारै सरूवा गरिएको छ। डिएसपी रेग्मीले भने सई अर्यालको घर भत्कीएकाले उनालाई केही दिन ' रिलिफ' दिनका लागि उनको स्थानमा अर्का सई पठाईएको दावी गरे।

data.summary: News: PM warns of action in case of foul play in relief distribution | राहतमा गडबड गरे जेल : प्रधानमन्तरी।
data.content:
NepalMonitor.org SMS Alert: Kathmandu/May 14, Rahat bitaran ma pakchhyapat gare jel chalan garne pradhanmantri Sushil Koirala ko chetawani.

Prime Minister Sushil Koirala has warned of taking action against anyone involved in irregularities and discrimination in the distribution of relief meant for the earthquake victims.

The Prime Minister made the statement while receiving Rs 2.5 million in relief assistance that the National Cooperatives Federation Nepal contributed to the Prime Minister Disaster Relief Fund.

"It is a crime to pocket the money meant for the relief of the victims; action would be taken if corruption is committed in the relief, rehabilitation and reconstruction works to be carried out in the quake-affected areas," the PM said.

Stating that the Nepalis have the culture of supporting each other even by forgoing meals at times of disaster, PM Koirala appreciated the assistance provided by the Federation and other Nepali organisations with generous heart.

He reiterated that directives have been issued to the bodies concerned to see that fairness is maintained in the relief distribution.

Federation chairman and CA member Keshab Prasad Badal handed over a cheque of that amount to the Prime Minister on the occasion.

A delegation of the Federation including chairman Badal had reached the Prime Minister's official residence at Baluwatar to hand over the amount to the Prime Minister.

It is said that relief materials worth Rs 20 million collected and despatched by the Indian Farmers Fertilizers Ltd under the coordination of the Fed.

प्रधानमन्त्री सुशील कोइरालाले भूकम्प पीडितहरुको निमित्त आएको राहत वितरणमा अनियमितता र पक्षपात गर्नेलाई जेल हाल्ने बताएका छन् ।

राष्ट्रिय सहकारी संघका तर्फबाट प्रधानमन्त्री दैवी प्रकोप उद्धार कोषमा दिइएको सहयोग रकम ग्रहण गर्दै प्रधानमन्त्रीले यस्तो चेतावनी दिएका हुन् ।

संघे प्रधानमन्त्री दैवी प्रकोप उद्धार कोषमा २५ लाख रुपैया योगदान गरेको छ । बिहीबार बिहान प्रधानमन्त्री निवासमा आयोजित एक कार्यक्रम संघका अध्यक्ष केशव बडालले प्रधानमन्त्री कोइरालालाई हस्तान्तरण गरेका हुन् ।

प्रधानमन्त्री कोइरालाले नेपालीहरुमा एकर्कालाई विपद् पर्दा गाँस काटेर सहयोग गर्ने सुसंस्कार रहेको उल्लेख गर्दै भूकम्पले मुलुकमा ल्याएको विपद्को सामना गर्न संघ लगायत नेपाली संस्थाहरुले गरेको सहयोगको प्रशंसा गरे ।

कोइरालाले पीडितहरुका लागि आएको राहतको रकम खानु अपराध भएको टिप्पणी गरे ।

data.summary: THT: Man killed over land dispute in Rautahat | राैतहतमा जग्गाको विषयमा विवााद हुँदा एक जनाको ज्यान गयो।
data.content:
NepalMonitor.org SMS Alert: Rautahat/May 14, Jagga ko bisaya ma bibad huda ek janaa ko mrityu, hatya ma samlagna 3 janaa lai prahari le pakryo.

A man was thrashed to death over a land dispute in Sarmujwa-5 of the district on Thursday.

According to the District Police Office, Rautahat, the deceased has been identified as Badir Baitha of Sarmujwa.

Police said that krita kishor Baitha, Brija Kishor Baitha, Laxman Baitha and Dashai Baitha killed Badir after a dispute ensued among them this morning.

SP Sanubabu Thapaliya informed that they have arrested three persons in connection to the incident while they were trying to cross the Nepal border.

Further investigation into the incident is underway, police informed.

data.summary: News: Death toll from May 12 quake reaches 96 | मंगलबारको भूकम्पमा मृत्यु हुनेको संख्या ९६ पुग्यो ।
data.content:
NepalMonitor.org SMS Alert: Kathmandu/May 14, Mangalbar ko bhukampa ma pari mrityu hune ko sankhya 96 pugyo, 2500 bhanda badhi ghaite.

Death toll from the May 12 quake and aftershocks has so far reached 96 while the score of injured recorded at 2,563.

The deaths are 11 in Kathmandu Valley, 40 in Dolakha, 16 in Sindhupalchowk, 11 in Ramechhap, three each in Sindhuli, Sarlahi and Mahottari, two each in Mahottari, Rautahat and Gorkha and one each in Dhading, Nuwakot, Sarlahi, Dhanusha and Terhathum, said Nepal Police's Deputy Inspector General (DIG) Kamal Singh Bam. RSS

मंगलबार गएको पराकम्पनका कारण ज्यान गुमाउनेको संख्या ९६ पुगेको छ । २ हजार ५ सय ६३ जना घाइते भएका छन् । नेपाल प्रहरीका अनुसार अहिलेसम्म मध्य क्षेत्रमा ७९ जनाको ज्यान गएको छ । यसैगरी उपत्यकामा ११, पूर्व क्षेत्रमा ४ र पश्चिम क्षेत्रमा २ जनाको ज्यान गएको छ । सबैभन्दा धेरै उपत्यकामा १ हजार ५ सय ८५ जना घाइते भएकामा ९ सय ७७ जनाको उपचार भैरहेको छ ।

data.summary: News: Man nabbed for slitting wife's throat in Nawalparasi  | खुर्पाले हानेर श्रीमतीको हत्या ।
data.content:
NepalMonitor.org SMS Alert: Nawlaparasi/Apr 10, Khurpa le hanera srimati ko hatya gareko arop ma prahari dwaara ek janaa aaja bihana pakrau.

Police on Friday arrested a man on charge of murdering his wife.

The suspect has been identified as Ham Bahadur BK (24) of Kokhetar, Arkhala-9 of the district.

According to a preliminary investigation, BK allegedly killed his wife Rita BK (21) by slitting her throat while they had gone to a well in a jungle near their village to take bath yesterday afternoon.

Police came to know about the incident only on Thursday night.

Following the information, a joint police team deployed from the Kawasoti and Baglungtar detained BK from Hurhuredanda of Devchuli of the district this morning, SP Nal Prasad Upadhyay of the District Police Office, Nawalparasi informed.

Police nabbed him while he was heading towards India via Madhesh to evade the arrest.

Police said that they are looking into the case.

data.summary: INSEC: CPN-M (Biplab) captures land | विप्लव माओवादीद्धारा चार सय रोपनी जग्गा ‘कब्जा’ ।

CPN-M led by Biplob has announced capture of 452 bigaha of land in Kusmethali of Thansingh VDC-1 and 2.

थानसिङ गाविस–१ र २ कुस्मेथलीमा रहेको ४ सय ५२ रोपनी जग्गा नेकपा माओवादी विप्लव समूहले चैत २६ गते कब्जा गरेको घोषणा गरेको छ ।

नेकपा माओवादी (विप्लव) का जिल्ला सचिवालय सदस्य नारायण नेपालको नेतृत्वमा गएको १० जनाको समूहले जग्गामा पार्टीको झण्डा गाडेर कब्जा गरेको घोषणा गरेको हो । 

राजपरिवारसँग नाता जोडिएको भनिएका दिवाकर चन्दको नाम रहेको भनिएको उक्त जग्गा जग्गा कमाउनेहरूलाई थाहै नदिई बेच्न खोजेको भन्दै कब्जा गरिएको नेकपा माओवादीद्वारा जारी विज्ञप्तिमा जनाइएको छ ।

जिल्ला सेक्रेटरी मिना वाइवाद्वारा जारी विज्ञप्तिमा थानसिं गाविस–१ र २ मा रहेको सो जग्गामा हाल २७ परिवार बसोवास गर्दै आएकोले जग्गा बिक्री वितरण नगर्न र कमाउने किसानलाई नै जग्गा दिन माग गरिएको छ । 

नेकपा माओवादीका सचिवालय सदस्य नारायण नेपालले जमिन जमिनदारको नभई उपभोग र जोत्ने किसानको हुनुपर्ने भन्दै स्थानीयवासीको जग्गा प्राप्तिको आन्दोलनमा आफूहरू जस्तोसुकै मूल्य चुकाउन पछि नहट्ने चेतावनी दिए । 

यसअघि २०५७ साउन १५ गते पनि तत्कालीन नेकपा माओवादीले सो जग्गा कब्जा गरेको घोषणा गरेको थियो । 

२०२२ सालदेखि बसोवास गर्दै आएको जग्गामा आफूहरूलाई झुक्याएर दिवाकर चन्दले नापीको समयमा आफ्नो नाममा कागजपत्र तयार गरेको जग्गा उपभोग गर्दै आएका रामकृष्ण विकले बताए ।

हाल उक्त जग्गामा केही नयाँ नयाँ मानिसहरू ‘यो जग्गा हाम्रो भइसक्यो । तिमीहरूले छाड्नु पर्छ’ भन्दै आउने गरेको जग्गा उपभोग गर्दै आएका विकले बताए ।

तत्कालीन समयमा तीन घरबाट बढेर अहिले २७ परिवार बसोवास गर्दै आएको छ । लामो समयदेखि बसोवास गर्दै आएका स्थानीयहरूले आफूहरूले लामो समयसम्म उपभोग गरेका जग्गा आफूहरूले नै पाउनुपर्ने बताएका छन् ।

यता सरकारले दिएको सुबिधा पुन सरकारले खोसेको भन्दै चन्द्रनिगाहपुरमा चार दिनअघि देखि आन्दोलन शुरु भएको छ ।
 
चन्द्रनिगाहपुरबाट सेवा केन्द्रको सुबिधा खोसिएको भन्दै जन ज्योती क्याम्पसका विद्यार्थी आन्दोलित हुदै आएका थिए । चन्द्रनिगापुरस्थित लोकतान्त्रिक चौकमा रिले अनशन शूरु भएको छ । 
 
गएराति अनशनमा नेकपा माओवादीका जिल्ला इन्चार्ज एकराज थापा, होटल व्यवसायी संघ रौतहटका अध्यक्ष सुरेन्द्र सापकोटा, साहित्यकार हरिकृष्ण काफ्ले , दिद्यार्थी नेता सुमन गौतम र व्यापारी बिष्णु न्यौपाने बसेका छन ।
 
मंगलवार अनशनमा चन्द्रपुर नपा १ का नेपाली कांग्रेसका कार्यकर्ता भरत आचार्य, व्यापारी बिनोद गुप्ता, उद्योग वाणिज्य संघ चन्द्रपुरका अध्यक्ष बासुदेव अधिकारी, थारु कल्याणकारी संघ रौतहटका कोषाध्यक्ष जितेन्द्र चौधरी, एमालेका चन्द्रपुर नगर इन्चार्ज विनोद घिमिरे बसेका थिए ।
 
चन्द्रनिगाहपुर तथा गरुडा बजारमा सरकारी कार्यालयको सेवा केन्द्रका् माग गर्दै राजनैतिक दल, व्यापारी , नागरिक समाज , स्थानियबासी आन्दोलित भएका छन । रौतहटको क्षेत्र नम्वर ६ र ५ को १९ गाविसका जनतालाई सहज हुने गरी नापी र मालपोत सेवा केन्द्र चन्द्रनिगाहपुरमा राख्ने निर्ण्र्ााभए पनि सरकारले फिर्ता लिएको थियो ।

आन्दोलनकारीले चन्द्रनिगाहपुर चौकमा सांकेतिकरुपमा नापी र मालपोत कार्यालयको सेवा केन्द्र समेत खोलेका छन ।

data.summary: eKantipur: (Banda update) 46 arrested, 11 vehicles vandalised | ४६ पक्राउ, ११ सवारी साधनमा क्षति ।
data.content:

Update
___________________________
Daily life started to limp back to normalcy with the end of strike from 5 pm today. Vehicles have started plying the road and market places have opened. The strike had been enforced from 5 am in the moring.
___________________________

Police have arrested 46 Banda enforcers from various places across the nation on the first day of three-day general strike called by the UCPN (Maoist)-led alliance of 30-opposition parties on Tuesday.

Nepal Police spokesperson DIG Kamal Singh Bam informed that 21 people were arrested from the Kathmandu Valley. It has been learnt that 11 vehicles including motorcycle, taxi, have been vandalaised by the banda enforcers, police said.

Two motorbikes were torched at Bijulibazaar in Kathmandu. A motorcycle bearing the registration number (Ba 32 Pa 5566) was torched in the afternoon, and another one (Ba 66 Pa 7206) was set ablaze earlier in the day.

Tension ensued in Bijulibazaar after the protestors clashed with the security personnel earlier in the day. Police had to use tear gas shells to contain the situation. A large number of security personnel have been deployed at the site.

According to post photographer Nimesh Jang Rai, the situation at Bijulibazaar area returned to normalcy. The cadres of the opposition parties were singing and dancing on the road without any violence.

Meanwhile, a motorcycle has been torched at Surkhet.

 ३० दलीय मोर्चाले आह्वान गरेको आमहड्तालको पहिलो दिन जर्वजस्ती यातायत बन्द गराउन खोजेका ४६ जनालाई पक्राउ गरिएको प्रहरीले जनाएको छ । त्यसमध्ये उपत्यका भित्रैबाट २१ जनालाई नियन्त्रणमा लिइएको नेपाल प्रहरीका केन्द्रीय प्रवक्ता डिआईजी कमलसिंह बमले बताएका छन । प्रहरीका अनुसार ११ वटा सवारी साधनमा बन्दकर्ताले क्षति पुर्याएका छन् ।

काठमाडौंको बिजुली बजारमा प्रदर्शनकारीले पछिल्लो समय थप एउटा मोटरसाईकलमा आगजनी गरेको छ । बा.३२.प ५५६६ नम्बरको मोटरसाईकलमा आगजनी गरिएको जनाइएको छ । यसअघि  बिहानै एउटा ट्याक्सीमा आगजनी गरिएको थियो । प्रहरी र प्रदर्शनकारीबीच अपरान्ह बिजली बजार क्षेत्रमा झडप पनि भएको थियो । त्यहाँ प्रहरीले लाठी चार्जसँगै अश्रृ ग्यास प्रहार गरेको थियो ।

बिजुलीबजारमा रहेका ईकान्तिपुरकर्मी निमेषजंग राईका अनुसार पछिल्लो समय त्यहाँको स्थिति समान्य रहेको छ । सडक ढाकेर बसेका बन्दकर्ताहरु गित र नृत्य गरेर रमाईरहेका छन् । ठूलोसंख्यामा सुरक्षाकर्मी परिचालित छ ।

डिआईजी बमका अनुसार सुर्खेतमापनि एउटा मोटरसाईकलमा आगजनी गरिएको छ । त्यस बाहेक मुलुकभर गरी ८ वटा सवारी साधनमा तोडफोड गरिएको उनले जनाए । बिजुलीबजार बाहेक अन्यत्र कतै झडप नभएको प्रहरीले जनाएको छ ।

Maiti Nepal has urged the government to adopt a special measure to control women trafficking, reasoning the traffickers have begun a new route to deport girls/women to Gulf countries via Bangladesh from Kakarbhitta border pointy of east Nepal.

When India introduced of 'no objection letter' for the Nepali people going to the third countries, especially to the Gulf, via its airport, the traffickers explored the new route for the crime.

Jahir Ansari (65) in Pokhariyatol of Gaur was found dead with his throat slit at his home this morning, DSP Sudhir Raj Shahi said.

Pervez Ansari from Gaur Municipality-10, an acquaintance of Jahir, had come to the victim’s house last night to ask for shelter for the night.

As the house had only one bedroom, the victim’s wife had left for her son’s house nearby leaving her husband with the guest, police said.

Meanwhile, the suspect also stole Rs 500,000 cash from the victim, police said.

Jahir had received the money from his son, who is currently abroad for employment, for a house construction, just last week, police said.

While looking for the suspect, police are investigating into the case.

data.summary: The Guardian: Migrants building UAE cultural hub 'working in prison conditions' | साउदीमा सांस्कृतिक केन्द्र बनाउन खतिएका कामदारहरु जेलजस्तै जीवन बिताउन बाध्य ।
data.content:
NepalMonitor.org SMS Alert: Kathmandu/Apr 5, Saudi arab ma bandai gareko sanskritik kendra ka kaamdar haru jail jastai jiban bitauna badhya.

Trade unions and artists have condemned the conditions faced by migrant workers building a £17bn cultural hub in the United Arab Emirates, including new branches of the Louvre and the Guggenheim museums, as akin to an open prison.

The International Trade Union Confederation (ITUC) and Gulf Labor, a coalition of international artists, said the several thousand workers in the official labour camp on Saadiyat Island in Abu Dhabi were subject to segregation, a 10pm curfew and monitoring by security guards, and could only enter or leave on authorised buses.

The researchers found that thousands more Saadiyat workers living in camps elsewhere in the UAE, which they also visited in March, endured similar restrictions.

Sharan Burrow, general secretary of the ITUC, said: “People are treated like battery hens. They’re locked in. There are guards. They leave at 5.30-6am, they go home at 6-7pm in the evening, or later if they are forced to work overtime, often unpaid.”

Two of the Gulf Labor activists, who asked to remain anonymous for fear of reprisals by the UAE authorities, said the Saadiyat Accommodation Village (SAV) was inaccessible by foot and workers could only travel the 2km between the camp’s entrance and perimeter checkpoint by hourly shuttle buses. The camp shuts down at 10pm and any workers who miss the curfew are locked out overnight. Workers are only permitted to access their designated accommodation block.

Gulf Labor will present their findings at the Venice Biennale, the world’s most prestigious contemporary art event, in July, where the group is staging a series of talks highlighting the plight of the Saadiyat workers.

Although the UAE authorities have said working conditions are improving on Saadiyat, Gulf Labour said they found forced labour persisted. Many workers said they had to pay illegal recruitment fees to secure their jobs and also reported being forced to work overtime without additional pay.

One of the activists said: “I can’t imagine a situation being worse than what we saw in terms of the lack of respect for human dignity.”

The activists saw squalid conditions in other camps in Abu Dhabi and Dubai including bathrooms shared by 20 men without proper sanitation, sewage outside the main entrance, and makeshift food markets that looked like refuse dumps.

They said workers were in serious debt as a result of paying illegal recruitment fees to gain work on the island. One worker from Nepal said he would need to work for two years before he paid off his recruitment fee.

Meanwhile the ITUC has begun a social media campaign targeting the Guggenheim and one of its major sponsors, Dior, in a bid to push the museum to address labour conditions on Saadiyat, where the construction of its largest branch is expected to begin this year.

The first phase of the ITUC campaign highlights the disparity between the wealthy art patrons who paid up to$75,000 for a table at the Guggenheim’s international gala fundraising dinner in New York last November, sponsored by Dior, and the squalid and impoverished conditions of Saadiyat workers.

Burrow, who met Guggenheim director Richard Armstrong on Saadiyat earlier this month, said the campaign would also target the museum’s other sponsors, such as Hugo Boss, Tiffany & Co, Samsung and Phillips, and the other western institutions and companies involved in Saadiyat, where a branch of New York University has been built and a new Louvre museum is due to open next year.

The Guggenheim declined to comment. The Louvre and the Tourism Investment and Development Company (TDIC), which overseas the development of Saadiyat, did not respond to requests for comment.

The UN International Labour Organisation has launched an investigation into the abuse of migrant workers in the UAE, partly prompted by concerns about conditions on Saadiyat, which is due to be published by the end of the year.

The most recent audit of Saadiyat Island by PricewaterhouseCoopers, which was appointed by TDIC to monitor workers’ welfare, found that the company had not consistently enforced its employment practices policy, which is supposed to ensure the fair treatment of labourers.

According to the audit, TDIC imposed financial penalties against only three of the six contractors who were found to be in breach of the policy last year. However, the audit noted that TDIC has pledged to introduce a fairer employment code this year and has already made some improvements to facilities at the SAV, including door-to-door laundry services and new kitchens.

data.summary: eKantipur: Six Maoist parties demand nullification of SC's verdict | सर्वोच्चको आदेश खारेज गर्नुपर्ने माग गर्दै ६ माओवादीको प्रधानमन्त्रीलाई ज्ञापन ।
data.content:
NepalMonitor.org SMS Alert: Kathmandu/Apr 3, Aam-maafi sambandhi sarwochcha ko paramaadesh kharej hunu parne 6 Maobadi party ko maag.

Six Maoist parties including the UCPN (Maoist) have submitted a joint memorandum to Prime Minister Sushil Koirala saying that the recent Supreme Court verdict on transitional justice was against the spirit of peace accord.  

The apex court on February 26 had annulled the provision to provide blanket amnesty to all the cases related to the decade-long armed conflict, saying that it is against the established principles of justice, international law and the court’s earlier verdicts.

Submitting the memo to PM Koirala at his residence in Baluwatar on Friday, the leaders of the six Maoist parties—who were a major party to the conflict—demanded immediate nullification of the SC's verdict, release of those arrested on charges of war-era cases , and enforcement of legal provision for reconciliation in war-era political cases.

The SC ruling has barred the commissions--Truth and Reconciliation Committee ( TRC ) and Commission on Enforced Disappearance (CED)—from initiating reconciliation on their own without victims’ consent.

The memorandum was signed by UCPN (Maoist) Chairman Pushpa Kamal Dahal, CPN-Maoist Chair Mohan Baidya, CPN Maoist General Secretary Netra Bikram Chand, CPN (Maoist) Coordinator Matrika Yadav, CPN (Unified) General Secretary Pari Thapa and Revolutionary Communist Party General Secretary Mani Thapa was submitted to PM Koirala by Dahal today.

Responding to the appeal filed by 234 conflict victims in June 2014, the SC had issued the verdict, curtailing the discretionary powers of the TRC and the CED to grant amnesty.

Earlier, the commissions could recommend amnesty to perpetrators if deemed reasonable for it, except in cases of rape and grave rights violations. On less serious crimes where amnesty is permissible, the court made it mandatory to take consent of the victims.

The SC verdict was hailed by various human rights groups including UN High Commissioner for Human Rights saying that it has ended fears that perpetrators of serious human rights violation would get acquitted without trial.

द्वन्द्वकालिन मुद्दामा आफमाफी नदिनू भनी सर्वोच्च अदालतले माघ १४ गते दिएको परमादेश शान्ति सम्झौताको भावना विपरीत भएको भन्दै एमाओवादीसहित ६ माओवादीले संयुक्त रुपमा प्रधानमन्त्री सुशील कोइरालालाई ज्ञापन पत्र बुझाएका छन् ।

अध्यक्ष पुष्पकमल दाहाल, नेकपा-माओवादी अध्यक्ष मोहन बैद्य, नेकपा एकीकृतका महासचिव परि थापा, नेकपा (माओवादी) संयोजक मात्रिका यादव, क्रान्तिकारी कम्युनिष्ट पार्टीका महासचिव मणी थापा र नेकपा माओवादीका महासचिव नेत्रविक्रम चन्द विप्लवले हस्ताक्षर गरेको ज्ञापन पत्र एमाओवादी अध्यक्ष दाहाले प्रधानमन्त्रीलाई केहीबेर अघि बुझाएका हुन् ।

ज्ञापन पत्रमा सर्वोच्च अदालतको परमादेश खारेज गर्नुपर्ने, द्वन्द्वकालिन मुद्दामा पक्राउ परेकाहरुलाई रिहाई गर्नुपर्ने, द्वन्द्वकालिन राजनीतिक मुद्दाहरु तत्काल फिर्तागर्नुपर्ने लगायत माग गरिएको छ ।

data.summary: eKantipur: CIAA to drag 52 to court on Rs 790m graft charge | निरौलासहित चार दर्जनविरुद्ध भ्रष्टाचार मुद्दा तयार ।
data.content:
NepalMonitor.org SMS Alert: Kathmandu/April 3, Nepal Paryatan Board ka nirdeshak sahit 24 janaa biruddha bhrastachar mudda dayar garne tayari.

The Commission for Investigation of Abuse of Authority has decided to drag to court 52 individuals, including two sitting government secretaries and suspended Nepal Tourism Board (NTB) chief Subas Nirola, for allegedly embezzling Rs790 million while at the board.

After almost year-long probe into the irregularities at the NTB, a meeting of the anti-graft body on Thursday decided to file a corruption case against them. This is the first high-profile case prepared by the CIAA after Lokman Singh Karki took its helm about two years ago.

A 520-page charge sheet has been prepared against Forest Secretary Sharad Chandra Poudel and Law Commission Secretary Ranjan Krishna Aryal, including Joint-secretary Dilli Prasad Shiwakoti. The commission has accused Nirola of embezzling Rs330 million in procurements, according to CIAA Joint-spokesperson Keshav Ghimire.

Poudel was on the NTB board while he served the Department of Immigration as its director general, and Aryal was an invitee member on the board in the capacity of the joint-secretary at the Tourism Ministry. Shiwakoti is a joint-secretary at the Finance Ministry.

The board consists of 11 members—five representing the government, five from the private sector and the chairman. “Almost all the members who served alongside Nirola have been charge-sheeted,” said an official at the Special Court, who saw the charge sheet on Thursday evening.

The bid to register the case in court did not materialise on Thursday due to time constraints. A CIAA team that reached the court at around 4:15pm had to return without filing the case after Registrar Natibabu Lamichhane refused to register the case.

“I have to put my signature at the top and bottom of each of the 520 pages. So I asked them to come tomorrow,” said Lamichhane.

The CIAA has decided to register the case on Friday afternoon. “We were not able to file the case on Thursday and would be visiting the Court on Friday,” said CIAA Joint-spokesperson Ghimire.

Corruption at the Board came to light after the amended financial bylaws of NTB granted sweeping powers to its chief, Nirola, who was already accused of misappropriating funds while procuring goods. The amendments allowed the NTB to award contracts without competitive bidding. Also, the CEO was thus authorised to spend up to Rs10 million at a time for tourism promotion activities inside the country.

Based on complaints, the government had formed a probe panel headed by Joint-secretary Purna Chandra Bhattarai. The committee mandated to look into the irregularities and consequences of the revision in NTB chief’s powers had also found the involvement of then Tourism Secretary Sushil Ghimire in amending the bylaws in violation of the Public Procurement Act.

The report said the NTB was marred by policy and financial irregularities. It had exposed that the NTB’s 192nd board meeting chaired by then-Secretary Ghimire had passed a Rs74 million budget while its actual requirement was only Rs12.1 million. The partial budget agreed to by the meeting had been passed illegally without a quorum.

The extra funds were used to pay the salaries of 26 personal security guards hired by Nirola. The decisions were taken a day before Ghimire—the secretary at the Tourism Ministry—was due to retire.

अख्तियार दुरुपयोग अनुसन्धान आयोगले नेपाल पर्यटन बोर्डका तत्कालीन कामु प्रमुख कार्यकारी अधिकृत सुवास निरौलासहित चार दर्जन व्यक्तिले झन्डै ७५ करोड रुपैयाँभन्दा बढी भ्रष्टाचार गरेको दाबी गरेको छ।
आयोगले सार्वजनिक खरिद ऐन मिचेर बोर्डको ढुकुटीबाट निरौलाले ३३ करोड र अन्य पदाधिकारी, कर्मचारी र तत्कालीन सचिवले गरी ४२ करोड रुपैयाँ भ्रष्टाचार गरेको भन्दै बिहीबार विशेष अदालतमा मुद्दा लगे पनि ‘समय अभावका कारण' मुद्दा दर्ता हुन सकेन।
विशेष अदालतका रजिस्ट्रार नातिबाबु लामिछानेले सवा ४ बजे मात्रै ल्याएकाले मुद्दा दायर हुन नसकेको बताए। ‘५२ जनाविरुद्ध ७५ करोडभन्दा बढी बिगो मागदाबीसहित अख्तियारका प्रतिनिधिले आरोपपत्र ल्याएका थिए,' रजिस्ट्रार लामिछानेले नागरिकसँग भने, ‘झन्डै ६ सय पेजभन्दा बढीको आरोपपत्र भएकाले पनि पढ्न भ्याइएन, शुक्रबार बिहान दर्ता हुन्छ।'
यसअघि संसदको सार्वजनिक लेखा समितिद्वारा बोर्डका कामु सिइओ निरौलाले झन्डै एक अर्ब रुपैयाँभन्दा बढी भ्रष्टाचार गरेको भन्दै निलम्बन गरी छानबिन गर्न अख्तियारलाई निर्देशन दिएको थियो। लेखा निर्देशनको महिनौंपछि मात्र आयोगले बिहीबार मुद्दा तयार गरेको थियो। समितिको निर्देशनपछि निरौला गत कात्तिक ९ गते निलम्बित भएका थिए।
अख्तियारले बिहीबार मुद्दा दायर गरेर सार्वजनिक गर्न दिउँसो साढे ५ बजे पत्रकार सम्मेलन आयोजना गरे पनि मुद्दा दायर हुन नसकेपछि पत्रकार सम्मेलन स्थगित भएको थियो। अख्तियार स्रोतका अनुसार भ्रष्टाचारमा संग्लन हुनेमा निरौलासहित तत्कालीन बोर्ड अध्यक्ष एवं पर्यटन सचिव सुशील घिमिरे, बोर्डका पदाधिकारी र कर्मचारी छन्।
अख्यितारले सार्वजनिक खरिद ऐन पालना नगरी र औचित्यबिना खरिद गरेको, विदेश भ्रमणका नाममा करोडौं खर्च गरेको, टेन्डर नै नगरी आफूनिकट व्यक्तिलाई करोडौंको काम दिएर अनियमितता गरेको आरोप लगाएको छ। त्यसैगरी बोर्ड सञ्चालक समितिको निर्णयबिना निरौलाले डेढ करोड रुपैयाँसम्म आफूखुसी खर्च गरेको, एउटै कम्पनीबाट सामान खरिद गर्दा थरीथरी बिल पेस गरेको पाइएको छ।
अख्तियारका सहायक प्रवक्ता केशवप्रसाद घिमिरेले बिहीबार मुद्दा दायर हुन नसकेकाले कस–कसविरुद्ध दायर भएको हो, पूर्ण विवरण सार्वजनिक नभएको बताए। ‘समय अभावका कारण मुद्दा दायर हुन नसकेपछि पत्रकार सम्मेलनमार्फत विवरण सार्वजनिक गर्न सकिएन,' घिमिरेले नागरिकसँग भने, ‘शुक्रबार मुद्दा दायर भएपछि दिउँसो पत्रकार सम्मेलनमार्फत विस्तृत विवरण सार्वजनिक हुन्छ।'

data.summary: eKantipur: KC to end hunger strike after striking deal with gov | साढे ३ बजे केसीको अनशन तोडिने ।
data.content:
NepalMonitor.org SMS Alert: Kathmandu/Apr 1, Sarkar le sabai maag pura garna sahamati janaaye pachhi doctor Govinda KC le aaja anshan toddai. 

Dr Govinda KC, who has been staging fast-unto-death for the past 12 days demanding reforms in the country’s medical sector, has agreed to end his hunger strike after reaching an agreement with the government.

Supporters of the fasting doctor said that KC will end the strike today itself as the government agreed to fulfill all of his demands. The draft of the agreement was read out before the fasting doctor by the government talk team and signed by Dr KC, Chief Secretary Leela Mani Paudel, National Planning Commission Vice Chairman Dr Govinda Pokharel and Nepal Medical Association Chairman Dr Anjani Kumar Jha.

As per the deal, the government has agreed to form a commission in the next seven days under a former Appellate Court chief judge. The commission will make recommendations of taking action against education minister and officials for their involvement in granting medical affiliations from Kathmandu University.

The government has also agreed to assess the capacity of medical colleges and de-affiliate colleges that are found below par.  Likewise, affiliations to new medical colleges will be withhold until a medical education policy is formulated in the country.

The deal also includes making MD/MS/DM/MCH courses free in government universities from the next fiscal year and establishing at least one medical college in every development regions within the next five years.

Meanwhile, Nepal Medical Association, the umbrella organisation of medical doctors, has withdrawn its decision to shut all the Out Patient Department (OPD) services. NMA had shut the services across the country’s hospital supporting Dr KC’s demands and condemning government’s apathy towards him. Thousands of patients across the country were hit hard due to the shut down in services.

डा. गोविन्द केसीले अनशन थालेकाे १२ औं दिन आज साढे ३ बजे तोडिने भएको छ । डा. केसी र सरकारका मुख्य सचिव लिलामणि पौडेलले  सहमतिको मस्यौदामा हस्ताक्षर गरेका छन् ।

केसीले नियमविपरीत सम्बन्धन प्रक्रिया अघि बढाउने विश्वविद्यालय र मेडिकल काउन्सिलका पदाधिकारी बर्खास्त गर्नुपर्ने र शिक्षा मन्त्रीलाई समेत कारवाही हुनुपर्ने भनी राखेको बारे छानविनका लागि आयोग बनाउने सहमति भएको छ ।

पुनरावेदन अदालतका पूर्व मुख्य न्यायाधीशकाे संयोजकत्वमा छानबिन आयोग बनाउने र सोही समितिकाे सिफारिसको आधारमा काम गर्ने सहमति भएको छ ।  केसीका अन्य सबै माग सरकारले पूरा गर्ने भएको छ ।

सहमतिमा सरकारको तर्फबाट मुख्यसचिव पाैडेलसहित योजना आयोगका उपाध्यक्ष डा. गोविन्द पोखरेल र साक्षीका रुपमा चिकित्सक संघका अध्यक्ष अञ्जनीकुमार झाले हस्ताक्षर गरेका छन् ।

कानुनमन्त्री नरहरी आचार्यले सरकार सहमति कार्यान्वयनमा दृढ भएको भन्दै गोविन्द केसी पुन यही मागको लागि अनशन बस्नु नपर्ने बताए ।

नेपाल चिकित्सक संघले डा. केसीको अनशनको समर्थनमा आयोजना गरेको आन्दोलनका सबै कार्यक्रम फिर्ता लिएको छ । संघले पत्रकार सम्मेलन गरी आन्दोलन फिर्ता लिएको घोषणा  गरेको हो । डा. केसी र सरकारका मुख्य सचिव लिलामणि पाैड्यालबीच सहमतिमा हस्ताक्षर भएलगत्तै संघले यस्तो घोषणा गरेको हो ।

संघको घोषणासंगै दुई दिनदेखि देशभरका अस्पतालमा ठप्प भएको ओपीडी सेवा सूचारु भएको छ ।

data.summary: THT:  Notorious trafficker‚ brothel keeper jailed after 17 yrs |  मुम्बईमा कोठी सञ्चालन गर्ने सोनु सत्र वर्षपछि पक्राउ ।
data.content:
NepalMonitor.org SMS Alert: Kathmandu/April 2, Mumbai ma afno kothi ma yuwati lai beshyabriti garna lagaune Sonu 17 barsa pachhi pakrau parin.

A 60-year-old woman who had been running a brothel in Mumbai of India by trafficking young girls from Nepal and forcing them to sell sex has been arrested after 17 years of her conviction by the Kathmandu District Court.

On November 23, 1998, the KDC had heard that Saraswati Lama aka Sonu was guilty in several sex trafficking cases in 1996.

A jail term of 10 years was slapped on her in absentia. The Appellate Court had also upheld the KDC verdict.

Police said Lama was directly involved in girls trafficking from Nepal to India and running brothel in Mumbai at present also.

Acting on a tip-off provided by the Maiti Nepal, a team deployed from the Central Investigation Bureau of Nepal Police apprehended her from Boudhha yesterday and presented her before the KDC today for the execution of 1998 verdict.

SP Kiran Bajracharya of CIB informed that police could get hold of the notorious brothel keeper, who had been dodging the law enforcement agencies till now, when she had come to Kathmandu from Mumbai to take part in death rituals of her mother, who recently died.

The KDC has sent the convict to the Central Jail in Jagannath Dewal to serve her term.

Lama had bought a girl from traffickers including Krishna Pariyar and Ramesh Ram in Mumbai in September 1996, according to CIB.

She had forced the victim to serve as prostitute in her brothel for some days before selling her to another brothel, ran by her sister Meera, in Mumbai.

Indian police had rescued several girls including the victim and handed over them to the Bhairahawa-based Maiti Nepal’s office. They were then brought to Kathmandu to take asylum at the Maiti Nepal’s hostel.

The Maiti Nepal had filed complaint against Lama and others, and a case was filed against them at the KDC in May 1998.

केन्द्रीय अनुसन्धान ब्युरोले बौद्धले पक्राउ गरी उनलाई आज काठमाडौँ जिल्ला अदालत पेस गरेकामा अदालतले आजकै मितिदेखि कैद भुक्तानका लागि केन्द्रीय कारागारमा पठाएको छ ।विसं २०५३ भदौमा कृष्ण परियार र रमेश रामसमेतका व्यक्तिले पीडित युवतीलाई बिक्रीका लागि भारतको मुम्बई पु¥याई लामालाई बेचेका थिए । लामाले ती युवतीलाई आफ्नो कोठीमा केही दिन वेश्यावृत्तिमा लगाई पुनः अर्की मीरा भन्नेलाई बिक्री गरेकी थिइन् । पीडितलाई यातना दिएर वेश्यावृत्तिमा लगाइरहेको अवस्थामा भारतीय प्रहरीले उद्धार गरेको थियो ।

data.content:
NepalMonitor.org SMS Alert: Gulmi/April 2, Baalika lai balaatkar gareko arop ma hirasat ma raheka 65 barsiya pujari lai 12 barsha kaid faisala.

A 65-year-old priest who was being held in custody for allegedly raping a nine year old girl has been sentenced to 12 years in prison by the District Court of Gulmi.

Khima nanda Aryal, a priest of Paramananda Shanti Ashram Shivalaya temple had raped the innocent minor on the temple's roof. The court has also fined him Rs 30,000 in order to compensate the victim.

केहि महिना अघि गुल्मीको जोहाङ्ग गाविसमा ९ वर्षिया वालिका वलात्कार गर्ने स्थानिय एक मन्दिरका बृद्ध पुजारीलाई आज गुल्मी जिल्ला अदालतले १२ वर्ष कैद सजायको फैसला गरेको छ । आज जिल्ला न्यायधिस ऋषिराम आचार्यको ईजलासले गत वर्षको चैत्र ६ गतेका दिन जोहाङ्ग १ को चोरकाटेस्थित परमानन्द शान्ति आश्रम शिवालय मन्दिरको छतमा स्थानिय ९ वर्षिया वालिकालाई बलात्कार गर्ने सोही मन्दिरका पुजारी ६५ वर्षिया खिमानन्द अर्याललाई १२ वर्ष कारावास सजाएँ र पिडित वालिकालाई ३० हजार रुपैयाँ निजबाट क्षतिपुर्ति दिलाउने फैसला गरेको हो । उक्त दिन अरु वालवालिका संगै खेल्न आएकी ति वालिकालाई मन्दिरमा अरुले चढाउन ल्याएको केरा, स्याउ सुन्तला लगायतका फलफुल खान दिई फकाएर त्यस मन्दिरका पुजारी अर्यालले माथि छतमा लगेर बलात्कार गरेको उजुरी परे पछि प्रहरीले तत्काल निजलाई पक्राउ गरेको थियो । जिल्ला अदालत गुल्मीले गत वर्षको चैत्र ८ गते देखि पुर्पक्षका लागि थुनामा राखेका उनलाई आज जिल्ला न्यायधिस ऋषिराम आचर्यको ईजालासले उक्त सजाएँको फैसला गरेको त्यस अदालतका श्रेस्तेदार रामविहारी मौर्यले जानकारी दिए । मौर्यका अनुसार वलात्कार अभियोगी अर्यालको घर गुल्मीकै आँपचौर ८ मा रहेको छ । उनि केहि वर्ष यता चोरकाटेको त्यस मन्दिरमा पुजारी काम गर्दै आई रहेको थिए । पहेलो वस्त्रमा सजिएर निदारमा रातो पहेलो टिका लगाउने र हरदम हरेराम हरे शिव जप्ने ति पुजारी अर्यालले त्यस्ती अवोध वालिकालाई त्यस्तो कुकर्म गर्ने गरेको खुलसा सोही दिन साँझ तिनै वालिकाबाट भएको हो । ६५ वर्ष उमेरका बृद्ध त्यस माथी मन्दिरका पुजारी अर्यालले अवोध वालिका वलात्कार गरेको घटना वाहिर आउन साथ उनको सर्वत्र निन्दा भएको थियो । उनि घरमा श्रीमतिको मृत्यु पश्चात धर्मकर्म गरेर मन शान्ति प्राप्तीका लागि जोहाङ्गस्थित उक्त मन्दिरमा पुजारी बस्न आएका थिए । तर दुर्भाग्य पुजारी वस्न आएको दुई वर्ष वित्न नपाउँदै उनले ९ वर्षिया अवोध वालिका वलात्कार गरेको घटना बाहिर आउँदा धर्म कर्मका नाममा पशुतुल्य ककुर्म गर्ने कतिपय पुजारी पनि समाजमा हुँदा रहेछन भन्ने कुराले स्थानियवासीलाई पिरोलेको छ ।
